results.title: Principal Consultant
results.description:
Principal Consultant

Full-time, Part-time and Remote opportunities available

About us

We're Nine Feet Tall … and growing! We can help do the same for your career.

We understand how crucial it is to make the right move at this stage of your career. You need more than a job description – you want to know what we stand for and whether Nine Feet Tall is a place where you can put down roots.

We're a management consultancy that's helped customers deliver over £100m of value in the last sixteen years. Our core mission is to take the pain out of change, and to ease the transition to new ways of working.

We use our core values to guide our decision making – acting with integrity and doing the right thing, always striving for excellence and delivering with real passion.

About you

Your career to date will have given you a solid background in leading business or IT transformation projects or managing change.

You'll already know that you're a highly competent Project or Change Manager. You may be working in a consultancy at the moment and you've hit a ‘glass ceiling'. Or perhaps you have always wondered about the benefits of working in a consulting environment, enjoying the variety of projects and sectors that you can operate in.

More than anything, you'll be looking to rapidly increase your skills and experience. We'll work with you to improve your commercial awareness – helping you to feel comfortable in networking with customers, leading and motivating others, and being a problem solver within our business.

The role

At Principal Consultant level, we would expect for you to develop quickly within our business.

When you start you'll likely be quickly deployed onto a customer's site, with our support, to play a key role in helping them to deliver a critical project. This will help you to understand Nine Feet Tall's ways of working and learn from Consultants who can help you attune to our culture and practices.

You'll also be asked to pick up internal projects, which could touch on any part of our growing business.

The other key aspect to this role is mentoring. We work in a non-hierarchical way, doing away with traditional line management and having mentors instead. At Principal level you'll work with one or two of our Consultants, providing advice and guidance on their current and future development.

Why apply?

We deliver all the capabilities of large consultancy with far less jargon and a more personality.

The last few years have been tough for everyone, but we stood strong. In 2022 we're growing taller again. Our culture is something we're really proud of and it could be something that you get to benefit from.

Our learning and development programme is extensive, meaning that you'll get to continue your learning whilst passing on your experience at the same time. In return for your knowledge, skills and experience we'll make ongoing investment in your professional development and provide fantastic opportunities for you to progress your career. 

As an employer, we're proud to be truly flexible. We work hard to help our team find balance in their working and personal lives. That's why we're happy to consider applicants on either a full-time or flexible working (part-time 4 days per week or flexi-hours) basis. You'll be home-based in the first instance, with flexibility to come to our office in Bath 1 -2 times per month to training and for our regular Company Days that play a big role in our cohesive team culture.

We are growing our team across all roles so we'd love to hear from you and tell you more about what's on offer.

Remuneration

£45,000+ plus bonus and competitive benefits package

Nine Feet Tall is an equal opportunities employer. We know that the principles of diversity, equality and inclusion are key to being a successful and dynamic business - with a team which is engaged and where everyone feels a sense of belonging and is happy to be themselves.

results.title: Executive Assistant To CEO
results.description:
We are looking for an Executive Assistant to perform a variety of administrative tasks and support our company’s CEO and senior-level managers. Executive Assistant’s responsibilities include managing calendars, making travel arrangements and preparing expense reports. To be successful in this role, you should be well-organized, have great time management skills and be able to act without guidance. Ultimately, you will contribute to the efficiency of our business by providing personalized and timely support to executive members.

Growth Cave is an eLearning company in the online marketing & advertising industry. We teach people how to sell online courses around their knowledge & expertise, using social media ads to get customers. Lucas Lee-Tyson (the CEO) started the business from his college dorm room when he had over $20,000 in student loan and credit card debt. In just 4 short years he has been able to grow the business to over $15M+ per year with 25+ full time employees, who all work remotely. Our reputation is one of the best in the online marketing industry and we are on pace to hit over $50M+ year within the next 2 years. We are looking for dedicated, ambitious team members who want to join a fast-paced work environment with massive opportunity for growth!

For more information about our business and what we offer to clients, please see here: https://go.growthcave.com/kba-vsl

 

Responsibilities
  • Act as the point of contact among executives, employees, clients and other external partners
  • Manage information flow in a timely and accurate manner
  • Manage executives’ calendars and set up meetings
  • Make travel and accommodation arrangements
  • Oversee the performance of other clerical staff
  • Take minutes during meetings

Requirements

  • Work experience as an Executive Assistant, Personal Assistant or similar role
  • Outstanding organizational and time management skills
  • Excellent verbal and written communications skills
  • Discretion and confidentiality

Benefits

  • Training & Development
  • Paid Time Off (Vacation, Sick & Public Holidays)
  • Work From Home
  • Wellness Resources

results.title: Operations Specialist
results.description:
Present in MENA countries, OTO is a multi-language, All-in-one Shipping Management Software that helps Ecommerce Stores and Omnichannel brands to ship their e-commerce orders seamlessly with 100+ shipping companies locally and internationally. Our customers are looking for the best way to deal with shipping and OTO provides the easiest one. We are in the journey of building MENA's next global startup, but solving a global problem, which is shipping! How? Automation is one of our keywords (or OTOmation as we like to write it). Innovation and Automation together make shipping accessible to everyone.

OTO is always looking for high-energy, self-motivated, committed individuals who are passionate about their work. We’re building a culture where amazing people (like you) can do their best work at OTO. We have a no-door policy, which means we encourage openness, honesty, and respect for other points of view. Our team members enjoy a challenging environment and they take care of each other, but mostly we all love Pizza - you will know why later ;)

Looking for a company where you can be part of a quick learning team, shaping the future of global e-commerce? Welcome on board!

OTO is now on the hunt for an experienced and energetic Operations Specialist. You will bring your expertise and enthusiasm into the team, and drive OTO growth into the MENA Market. We are looking for someone who is highly enthusiastic, energetic, and results-driven.

 

Tasks:

You will be responsible for:

  • Handle the A to Z process of shipment flow;
  • Optimize operational processes and procedures for maximum efficiency while maintaining quality standards;
  • Assist with the implementation of new processes and procedures that help streamline OTO’s operations;
  • Ensure the closing of all Customer Success tickets related to AGG DC;
  • Act as an OTO representative regarding all AGG DC matters or claims;
  • Manage phase 1 of receiving and revising DC invoices and COD’s;
  • Conduct data analysis related to all AGG DC operations;
  • Work in collaboration with the Customer Success Team Members to ensure satisfactory customer satisfaction;
  • Conduct regular follow-ups with the Customer Success Department to maximize the potential for customer experience improvements;
  • Track and report on operational performance;
  • Any other duties as required by management.
For this role, it is essential that you have:

 

  • Proven work experience as an Operations Specialist or relevant role.

  • Bachelor’s degree in Industrial Engineering, Logistics, Supply Chain or a related field

  • Detail-oriented, organized with excellent verbal and written communication skills in both Arabic and English

  • Ability to perform and prioritize multiple tasks

  • Excellent data analysis and negotiation skills

  • Strong computer skills: proficiency in word processing, spreadsheets and database skills

  • Must be a Saudi citizen. 

It will be considered a big plus if you:

  • Have international experience.

  • Have previously worked in fast-growing SaaS start-ups.

Location:

In OTO, we have adapted the Remote Working culture, where we work from home, favourite coffee shop, on the beach, or at an art museum! You can work from anywhere you like. We are result-driven, and you will be surrounded by aggressive achievers. Keep in mind, we are not able to provide a Sponsorship Visa for this role; Therefore, It is essential that you apply for this position only if you have legal authorization to work in the country in which you are applying.

Benefits

  • No clocking in/out. We don’t believe in micromanaging and our working relationships are based on mutual trust, that’s why we don’t require our team to clock in and out of work. Of course, this trust relationship works both ways!

  • Work alongside an ambitious and supportive team. We are growing fast and no two days look the same at OTO, but one thing never changes: your colleagues are always there to support you and to bounce off ideas!

  • Growth and learning opportunities. We believe that in order to grow as a company, our team also needs to continue learning and developing.

  • Stock options: we believe that everyone should feel like building his own company! That's why we offer stock options for all employees working at OTO.

results.title: Business Analyst - Healthcare Revenue Cycle
results.description:
At Janus, we believe in a world where healthcare functions efficiently. Join us on our mission to improve the lives of administrative workers and fundamentally change the way work is done. Our team is building a world-class process improvement platform to help healthcare providers generate more cash with fewer resources.

We are looking for a Business Analyst with Revenue Cycle expertise to join our team! This person will be responsible for product design requirements gathering and streamlining of discovery for product enhancement activities. The Business Analyst will facilitate discovery sessions, create product build specifications, and confirm business case associated with product build or enhancement activities. This person will coordinate with cross functional teams including engineering, product, and customer success to confirm complete and comprehensive requirements for all product designs. A successful candidate will have high attention to detail, an appreciation for consistent documentation, an ability to creatively solve complete customer problems, and strong communication to coordinate amongst various teams.

This person will be an individual contributor within our Product team and should have a strong sense of autonomy in their individual tasks such as:

  • Independently facilitates discovery and design sessions for new complex build activities including new automation use cases or enhancements to existing functionality using best practices for automation design and development
  • Documents detailed specification for new build activities and confirms understanding of design with engineering, customer success, and product delivery teams
  • Maintains specification documentation in accessible and centrally located documentation system
  • Assists in the creation of automation design documents to support business decision-making, process streamlining, automation development and performance improvement to meet business and customer needs
  • Creates business case for build activity including defining inputs for value and success measure tracking in collaboration with customer success team
  • Partners with engineers and project managers to create timelines of automation development and business validation to leadership
  • Supports research through ongoing database investigation to confirm enhancement requirements or other data needs
  • Communicates clearly, timely and professionally, both in writing and verbally
  • Independently problem solves to remove blockers, identify risks and create mitigation plans, and escalate timely
  • Manages and guides cross functional team meetings to ensure discovery and design needs are met for ongoing product success
  • Facilitates activities with customer and internal teams as needed
  • Applies critical thinking to solve customer and internal problems
  • Identifies and escalates risks with proposed solutions and suggested recommendations
  • Serves as an active team member; participates in department and company wide initiatives; contributes to the overall culture
  • Other duties as assigned by Product Leadership

Requirements

  • 3+ years of Healthcare Revenue Cycle or Business Analyst work experience in a technical or customer facing role; must feel comfortable in the details
  • Preferred database design experience in analytical tools such as SQL, Tableau etc.
  • Preferred certification in Lean Six Sigma Green or Black Belt, CRCR
  • Self-motivated, persuasive, and proactive team player with innovative ideas to inspire team members
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills. Proven experience building strong internal relationships and collaborate with cross-functional teams
  • Detail-oriented, organized and process-driven, without losing sight of the bigger picture
  • Consistent ability to produce relevant documentation of procedures and testing approaches
  • Ability to suggest improvements and dig deep into optimizing and streamlining processes
  • Critical thinking skills to problem solve creatively within Janus technology suite
  • Comfort in technical planning and documentation tools such as Jira, Confluence, and Microsoft Teams
  • Flexibility and comfort working in a dynamic and constantly changing environment of an early-stage startup
  • Has fun, celebrates success, and contributes to a positive culture
  • Ability to work remotely in the United States

Benefits

  • 100% Company Paid Medical for employee coverage & a generous contribution for dependent coverage.
  • Unlimited PTO which is actually used! Take the time you need to be successful.
  • Employee Stock Options because we are building something together and want to share in the value we create
  • Work when and where you need with our flexible schedules and environments.
  • Save for your retirement with a 401k plan


Inclusivity

At Janus, we're committed to growing and empowering an inclusive community within our company and communities. This is why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of the best and brightest from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives across our organization. We are an equal opportunities employer and encourage everyone to apply for our available positions, even if they don't meet every requirement — including women, people of color, individuals with disabilities and those in the LGBTQIA+ community.


We are the Shapers of Culture
Our employees are our greatest asset, and we are passionate about creating strong culture with deep purpose. We are entrepreneurial and focused, yet humble, empathetic, and inclusive. We value the individual and tackle problems as a team. The best idea wins, and teams celebrate together. We are remote-first, well-funded, and growing fast!

We pride ourselves on being true to ourselves and authentic. We stand on the following tenets:

  • Ownership - everyone is a contributor and is empowered to drive improvement.
  • Curiosity - playing and learning every day.
  • Eagerness - demolishing barriers to building and innovating.
  • Radical Transparency - openness in communication and decision making across the organization.
  • Partnership over Profit - prioritizing long-term relationships.
  • Humility - we strive to be team players, setting aside ego.
  • Community - nurturing an environment where all employees and partners can thrive.

Our team is fun, innovative, and willing to roll-up our sleeves to help each other succeed in a fast-paced environment.

Disclaimer:

This job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change or new ones may be assigned.

This job description does not constitute a contract of employment and Janus Health Technologies, Inc. may exercise its employment-at-will rights at any time.

results.title: Executive Assistant
results.description:
About the Company

Headquartered in West Sacramento, Origin Materials is the world's leading carbon negative materials company. Origin’s mission is to enable the world’s transition to sustainable materials. Over the past 10 years, Origin has developed a platform for turning the carbon found in non-food biomass into useful materials, while capturing carbon in the process. Origin’s patented drop-in core technology, economics and carbon impact have been validated by trusted third parties and are supported by a growing list of major global customers and investors. Origin’s first plant is expected to be operational in 2022 with a second, full-scale commercial plant expected to be operational by 2025 and plans for additional expansion over the next decade. For more information, visit www.originmaterials.com.

Our People

We believe that diversity and inclusion among our teammates is critical to our success and we seek to recruit, develop and retain the most talented people from a diverse candidate pool. When you take a job at Origin, you do more than switch companies or advance your career. You become part of the Origin community: an inclusive group of hardworking, uniquely talented people who drive innovation.

Benefits and Perks

You will work with great people. You will be joining a close-knit group of A+ players who like to hustle, create, and work hard because we believe in Origin’s mission: to enable the world’s transition to sustainable materials.

You will make a difference. We’re working on big things, so every person has the opportunity to make an impact.

You will grow. There are endless opportunities at Origin to learn and improve. You’ll be surrounded by great minds and presented with big challenges. And you and your teammates will push one another to overcome those challenges.

You will enjoy excellent benefits. We offer a wide range of insurance including Medical and Dental, Vision, Disability, and Life, as well as a 401k, EAP, and generous leave.

You will have flexibility. We don’t believe in one size fits all when it comes to work location and schedule. We care about safety and efficiency so work where and when you are at your best. Also, we recognize our team works hard so we want you to take time off when you need it. That’s why we have a flexible time off policy.

About the Position

The primary role of the Executive Assistant is to support the CCO in communicating (internal and external), optimizing their time efficiency (for example, priorities, diary and appointments) and orchestrating the many facets of the their day-to-day activities including travel and meeting minutes.

The role of the CCO is intimately mixed with that of the remainder of the Commercial Transactions team and Co-CEO so the secondary aspect of the EA role is to help the wider CT team and Co-CEO coordinate both internally and externally, for example by arranging meetings.

The EA role is focused on increasing the efficiency of the CCO which can also be achieved by assisting the CT team as a whole. Therefore the EA role is concerned with efficiency, accuracy, quality and, above all, discretion

Effective EAs are frequently described as personable, accessible and efficient. The CT team EA will report to the Director of Business Development.

You will be responsible for:

Time Management of the CCO
The role helps to ensure the maximum time-efficiency of the CCO. A close relationship with CCO develops a thorough understanding of their priorities, preferences and methods of working. This enables the EA to anticipate and orchestrate the daily activities of the CCO to maximum efficiency by optimizing diaries, scheduling meetings, organizing travel and many other aspects.

Communication
When directed, the EA represents the CCO, and often then Co-CEO, both internally and externally. Whether dealing directly with colleagues or 3rd parties, organizing internal or external events, sending or making personal emails and phone calls or writing documents on behalf of the CCO or Co-CEO, the EA is focused on accuracy, professionalism and courtesy.

Information Creation and Organization
The EA creates, manages and stores a lot of business-critical information on behalf of the CCO. Whether by creating reports, taking minutes at meetings, email management, general document management or generating expense reports, the EA is concerned with 1st time accuracy, efficiency, logical organization and best practice.

CT Team Responsibilities
Aside from the CCO, the CT team comprises 4 other members however this is likely to grow in future. It is clear that the function of this role is not as EA to the whole team however the individual in the EA role possesses organizational skills and a unique network of internal and external contacts that can add significant efficiency to the whole CT team and therefore increase time-efficiency of the CCO; examples of this include

  • organization of internal and external meetings that are complex or with a large number of attendees
  • collation and organization of CT team information (such as databases)
  • liaising with 3rd parties such as senior members of customer or supplier organizations


Specific Responsibilities Include:

  • Schedule and coordinate meetings, conference calls and events with internal and external parties, making all required arrangements
  • Calendar management
  • Email management
    • Responding on his/her behalf when appropriate
    • Bringing items to his/her attention
  • Schedule and manage foreign and domestic travel arrangements
  • Submit and reconcile expense reports
  • Assistance with document management
  • Active time and resource management
  • Regularly sits in on meetings, takes notes and synthesizes information
  • Completes various writing projects for executive
  • Project participation/management
  • Organizing internal and external onsite visits
  • Flexible hours as dictated by the needs of business for projects and meetings.
  • Manage sensitive matters with a high level of confidentiality and discretion especially decisions directly impacting the global operations of the company.
About You
You:
  • Professional demeanor
  • Personable
  • Confidence in personal communication
  • Highly organized and efficient
  • IT literate (including Word, Excel, GMail, Google Calendar and other collaborative platforms that may include Zoom, Teams, Quip, Box and others)
  • Excellent spoken and written English (other languages may be beneficial)

Location:

  • Either Sacramento HQ or remotely in the USA
  • Location must ensure that EA can operate efficiently in the time zone of the co-CEO and CCO (Eastern Standard Time)
Your Experience:

Have to Have it:

  • 2-4 years in related role
A few last things:
  • We don’t hire based off of key words. We hire smart, capable, real people who are ready to learn and are enthusiastic about changing the world. If you think you’d be a good fit, we hope you are encouraged to apply.
  • Maybe you’re amazing but this job isn’t exactly what you’re looking for. We’ve learned that amazing people surround themselves with amazing people. Be a good friend and pass this along to someone you think might be the perfect fit!

results.title: Personal and Administrative Assistant
results.description:
About World Business Lenders (WBL)

WBL is a U.S.-based company with a 100% remote workforce. The company is seeking to bolster its staff with qualified talent in Turkey. This position will be a remote role based in Istanbul, Ankara or select other cities.

This is a remote Contract/Consultant position. Working hours will be 9:00am-6:00pm Eastern Time (4:00pm-1:00am or 5:00pm-2:00am Istanbul time), Monday through Friday. The job requires excellent oral and written command of the English language. Resumes must be submitted in English. Resumes provided in Turkish will not be reviewed.

Requirements

In this role, you will handle personal and administrative matters for WBL’s Chief Executive Officer (CEO). This includes managing household operations and logistics for multiple properties, handling financial matters, facilitation and coordination of calendars/meeting scheduling, making travel arrangements, and handling ad hoc projects and needs as requested. Exceptional communication skills, impeccable attention to detail and excellent judgment will be essential as you liaise with internal and external parties to ensure seamless functioning of the CEO’s schedule, and personal and work-related matters.

Responsibilities:

  • Provide administrative support to the CEO with respect to both personal and professional matters.
  • Manage an active calendar of appointments and meetings, including routine scheduling of calls, Zoom meetings and in-person meetings.
  • At the CEO’s request, attend meetings and take notes.
  • Handle restaurant and other reservations for the CEO and any guests.
  • Oversee 2 households, handling all maintenance and operational matters.
  • Create documents, spreadsheets and presentations, and compose correspondence.
  • Execute complex and detailed travel arrangements (including scheduling and managing of car services and, on occasion, flight and hotel accommodations), including preparing itineraries and compiling necessary documents.
  • Handle expense reporting, invoice processing and other financial matters.
  • Other projects and duties as assigned.

Desired Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Accounting (or related field of study), or equivalent experience.
  • Experience as a personal or administrative assistant to a senior-level executive strongly preferred.
  • High degree of proficiency with Microsoft Office products (Word, PowerPoint, Excel, Outlook, Teams), and Zoom.
  • Must be sharp, polished, professional and resourceful.
  • Exceptional English communication skills, both written and verbal, are imperative.
  • Impeccable diligence and attention to detail is required.
  • Must be flexible, nimble and adaptable to frequent changes to schedules/priorities.
  • Financial analysis skills, including maintaining financial matters, budgets and expenses, required.
  • Strong organizational, time-management and problem-solving skills, including planning, project management, troubleshooting and task facilitation.
  • Must be proactive with a strong work ethic and high energy level.
  • Ability to multitask and complete all projects within designated timeframes.
  • Must be prompt, dependable and have a “can-do” attitude.
  • Must have excellent interpersonal skills and be able to interact with a variety of individuals at various levels within and outside the company.

Benefits

$1,250 - $1,500 USD per month, depending on experience

results.title: Marketing Operations Manager
results.description:
Onfido is the new identity standard for the internet. We empower people around the globe to reach services they love and need simply, speedily and safely – whether they’re renting a car or opening a bank account or completing a high-value transaction where identity is key. We built a full-service suite of AI-powered identity verification solutions with fairness and inclusiveness at their core, and were awarded ‘Outstanding Leader in Accessibility’ and ‘Best Innovation in Algorithmic Bias Mitigation’ awards at CogX. 
 
Onfido is an established pre-IPO technology company with a prominent position in the global marketplace that has been repeatedly recognized for excellence in performance and innovation. In 2021 we were awarded ‘Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning Hot Company’ by CyberDefense Global Infosec Awards, ‘Fraud Prevention Innovation of the Year’ at the CyberSecurity Breakthrough Awards, and named to the CB Insights Fintech 250 for the fourth year running. We've received over $200 million in funding from investors including TPG Growth, Microsoft, and Salesforce to achieve our vision. We partner with thousands of businesses to help millions access services every week – from billion dollar institutions to hypergrowth unicorns. We support identities from 195 countries, and 2,500+ document types. Our recent growth is fuelled by continued increasing demand in the United States – where we’ve grown in year-over-year sales by 264% – as more enterprise organisations accelerate their digital transformation plans with Onfido. 
 
Our goal is to work together to promote and celebrate an inclusive and diverse community. Collectively, all Onfidoers are committed to creating an environment where everyone can be themselves, and where differences are celebrated. We encourage people from all backgrounds and cultures to come together to solve some of the world's most interesting problems.
 
The Opportunity
 
As a Marketing Operations Manager, you see endless possibilities for how our processes and technology can be a game-changer for the entire organization. As the new member of the fast-growing Growth Operations team, you will be identifying and implementing improvements and new tools across the MarTech stack. Thanks to you, MQLs will zip across to our SDRs at the speed of lightning, our email automation will work like clockwork and you’ll make our Marketing spend smarter than anyone else.



As a Marketing Operations Manager at Onfido you will:
  • Have complete ownership of our awesome MarTech stack, from marketing automation to outbound communications
  • Define the roadmap for Marketing Operations and shape the overall strategy
  • Identify and implement mind-blowing improvements in lead management, marketing ROI and account based marketing
  • Provide insight rather than information by helping to create powerful top-of-funnel metrics
  • Gather requirements from the field to work out how Marketing Operations can best support our Growth team
  • Train our teams on our tools so that they can all declare themselves ‘power-users’
  • Enhance our change management process to ensure all changes land smoothly through appropriate testing
  • Ensure all changes are adopted well using clear communications with all of the relevant users
  • Set the strategy for the entire Marketing Operations function



We’re looking for a Marketing Operations Manager who can display the below skills & experience throughout our interview process:
  • 5 years+ of experience with a Marketing Automation platform - e.g. Pardot (preferred but not required), Marketo, Hubspot etc
  • Experience implementing substantial improvements within a Marketing Automation tool, (e.g. lead scoring and grading, email nurture campaigns, segmentation)
  • Significant experience with Salesforce and have been responsible for lead management in a prior company
  • Integrated major Marketing applications or systems with Salesforce (e.g. Pardot, Marketo, Hubspot, Outreach, Drift)
  • An understanding of ABM and have experience with the tools which drive it (e.g. DemandBase/Engagio) 
  • Proficient in data manipulation and enjoy a good spreadsheet
  • Organized by nature, you may have been accused of having a well structured plan for absolutely everything
  • Strong interpersonal skills, people from all functions love working with you because they know you understand their pain points
  • Infinite drive, once you have figured out what needs to happen, you don’t stop until it is sorted
#LI-CV1 #LI-Remote
 
Onfido Culture
 
Onfidoer’s share a set of core values and want to hear from you if you believe in:
> Succeeding together; you work collaboratively and put the team first
> Taking pride; you care about quality, producing great work and customer / user outcomes
> Creating customer buzz; you demonstrate a strong user / customer focus
> Learning things & sharing them; you have a natural curiosity and default to sharing knowledge with others
> Finding a better way; you’re adept at finding solutions, experimentation and innovating to make things better
 
Onfido Balance
 
Personal hyper-growth requires a fast-moving environment, a clear career development plan and—crucially—looking after ourselves.
 
Onfido Balance is the toolkit we’ve developed to succinctly communicate our benefits offering:
> Our Body benefits prioritise health, wellbeing, exercise and recovery. 
> Our Head benefits are focussed heavily on learning whatever your learning style, mental wellness and flexible working.
> Our Heart benefits are framed around sharing our success with our peers, our local communities and our future selves in the form of equity, corporate social responsibility and better togetherness.
 
Check out Life at Onfido via our LinkedIn Careers Page!
 
Onfido is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive work environment. We're always on the lookout for talented, passionate people and encourage applications from all backgrounds regardless of age, disability, gender, sexual orientation, parental status, race or religion. If you need reasonable accommodation at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know.

results.title: Operations Business Analyst
results.description:
Powered by People is looking for an exceptional Operations Business Analyst to work closely with the Marketplace Operations Manager to design business processes and analyze key business data. The Operations Business Analyst will play a key role in scaling our operations function and improving the experience for our buyers and makers.

Requirements

Business Process Management

  • Document existing operational processes, identify opportunities for improvements and lead redesign and implementation of process changes
  • Identify issues, risks and benefits of existing and proposed solutions and outlining business impacts.
  • Select and implement goods required to manage business processes

 

Data Reporting and Analysis

  • Gather data reporting and analysis requirements from various functional teams and lead build of business dashboards
  • Analyze sales data such as budgets, sales results and forecasts

 

Product Feedback

  • Report on common sources of technical issues or questions and make recommendations to the product team
  • Communicate key insights and findings to the product team
  • Constantly be on the lookout for ways to improve monitoring, discover issues and better serve our buyers and maker

Benefits

PBP is a social enterprise startup whose mission and values of creativity, responsibility, innovation, diversity, transparency and sustainability drive us to be a force for good. Join a passionate global, remote-first team using technology to connect with one another and to connect small batch makers with buyers and conscious consumers. We provide meaningful, cross-functional & collaborative work and travel opportunities. We are reimagining a world Powered by People. Join us.

A few of our benefits include:

  • Global, remote-first company with mission-driven teams in Kenya, Türkiye, India, Canada, Colombia, Mexico, US and UK
  • Co-working space, if based in Canada
  • Travel opportunities
  • Flexible work schedule
  • Career development and advancement opportunities

results.title: CEO & Co-Founder
results.description:
Jumanji Studio is a startup studio founded by experienced entrepreneurs and investors in the impact space. Our goal is to build mindful businesses that fight environmental and social issues.

Since 2019, we’ve launched 7 startups, brought in 10 entrepreneurs (50% female) and a community of 70 advisors, exited our 1st startup, and raised a cumulative $4m across our studio and startups.

We are looking for the CEO & co-founder that will lead our next startup, a solution to decarbonize the goods delivery market.

What will this startup do?

Parcel Shipping has exploded during the last years due to the high growth of ecommerce and second hand platforms transactions

Nozama aims to decarbonize these deliveries by designing and building an innovative digital solution for ecommerce businesses to measure and improve the impact environment of their delivery and reduce their costs.

For this role, imagine being the founder of a startup and all the things it includes such as designing and launching the platform, strengthen the brand, vision, and strategy, drive the marketing and development of the company and overtime build a strong team to support its growth 🚀.

Are you the right person ?

For us, what defines the best leaders in a startup environment is attitude and values. You need to come with sheer optimism, a positive energy, a persevering courage, and an open mindset.

We want to work with people who have a real ambition for the planet. If you see yourself as dedicating all your skills for a positive change, then we’ll show you it’s possible.

You have an entrepreneurial mindset with the ability to juggle from one subject to another: you are able to balance big-picture thinking with the day-to-day tasks.

Startups are not for everyone! No day looks like the other, that’s why the entrepreneurial adventure is fantastic!

Requirements

You have experience in building digital solutions with a strong knowledge of the SaaS solutions for BtoB, sales leader and knowledge of supply chain logistics. You are familiar with the e-commerce market with 3 to 10 years of experience in entrepreneurship, with very good command of English.

 

If we have described you, Apply right away! Jumanji’s team, look forward to meeting you!

Learn more @ Jumanji Studio

Benefits

This position is fully remote, based in France (no sponsorship visa). We offer a Co-Founder equity package and a modest salary.

Contractor status is preferable at the beginning, but once the start-up is launched/scaled, a permanent contract is possible.
